definition: to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless

sentences.english: 'Go and get your clothes, you wicked girl, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: “去取你的衣服，你这个混账丫头，”他说。

sentences.english: I felt like a f**king after-school special.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉想一个混账的课后特殊服务。

sentences.english: Forget this Goddamn business of worrying about our flanks.
sentences.chinese: 忘掉这种提心吊胆防护侧翼的混账事儿。

sentences.english: He accused Klaus of leading a regime of "gangster capitalism".
sentences.chinese: 他指责克劳斯领导的政权制度是“混账资本主义”。

sentences.english: "Oh, " she said, "he's gone to Rome to blow out the damn candle!
sentences.chinese: “噢，”她说，“他去罗马去吹灭那支混账的蜡烛。”

sentences.english: What the hell kind of a man would write like that?
sentences.chinese: 到底什么样的混账才会写出这样的字啊？

sentences.english: People say that I am a crazy bastard.
sentences.chinese: 人家都说，我是个疯子，混账。

definition: how can this be so? (idiom); preposterous/ridiculous/absurd
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to work against the interests of sb one derives support from/to double-cross one's employer/to bite the hand that feeds you
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
